explanation: Sends a Wake-on-LAN magic packet to trigger a sleeping host to power on (Traffic Signaling). The tool constructs the packet as 6 bytes of 0xFF followed by the target MAC repeated 16 times. Detection: monitor outbound UDP broadcasts to port 7/9 and process execution of WakeMeOnLan; review NetFlow and Sysmon (Event ID 3) for unusual magic packet bursts.
rationale_steps: Invoke WakeMeOnLan to generate a valid WOL magic packet for MAC 00-11-22-33-44-55.
Broadcasts the signal to elicit device wake-up per T1205.
As Administrator, ensure PowerShell is elevated if local firewall/UAC policies restrict broadcast sending.
Detect via IDS for UDP port 9 broadcasts and EDR alerts on WakeMeOnLan.exe usage.
